Quote: “Shanghai’s clocks were set an hour ahead so the city could ‘save daylight’, but the Bai family said: “We go by the old clock.” Ten o’clock to them was eleven to everyone else. Their singing was behind the beat; they couldn’t keep up with the huqin Chinese string instrument producing bleak and desolate sounds] of life.”
Title: Love in a Fallen City
Author: Eileen Chang

Quote: “It was at ten o’clock to-day that the first of all Time Machines began its career. I gave it a last tap, tried all the screws again, put one more drop of oil on the quartz rod, and sat myself in the saddle. I suppose a suicide who holds a pistol to his skull feels much the same wonder at what will come next as I felt then.”
Title: The Time Machine
Author: H.G. Wells

Quote: This was a travelling fair, and we can imagine what a faint impression the public address system might have made against the caterwauling of shrieking teens, the clattering of the roller coaster, the thundering of the waltzer, the hollering of hawkers and hucksters, and the pounding basslines of fairground music. By ten o’clock when the noise had subsided, and when most of the revellers had dispersed into the night, no one had come forward to claim the little girl.
Title: Coincidents: a novel
Author: J.W Ironmonger

Quote: At night, a quiet so vast it seemed it seemed almost to reverberate. Few cars passed on Route 114, and after ten o’clock or so there were none at all. After ten, the part of the world where I had come to rest belonged only to the loons and the wind in the fir trees.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: “The short hand is pointing to 10,” says Poppy, “and the big hand is pointing to 12. So it must be 10 o’clock.”  “That’s right,” says Mrs. Boot. “Well done, Poppy.”
Title: Poppy and Sam’s Telling the Time Book
Author: Usborne

Quote: At ten o’clock, he went to Shinjuku and bought a Fujitsu word processor with his credit card. It was the latest model, far lighter than earlier versions.
Title: 1Q84, Book One
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: With the exception of the two or three streets, of which we shall presently speak, all was wall and solitude there. Not a shop, not a vehicle, hardly a candle lighted here and there in the windows; all lights extinguished by ten o’clock.
Title: Les Misérables
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: It was ten o’clock. And now he is dead, and the police will be called in, and I shall be suspected of having had a hand in it. Oh, yes, I am sure I shall. But you don’t think so, gentlemen? Surely you don’t think that it was I? Is it likely that I would have brought you here if it were I? Oh dear! oh dear! I know that I shall go mad!
Title: The Sign of Four
Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: On Saturday nights I still sat in the same chair in the dorm lobby. I knew a phone call wouldn’t come, but I had no idea what else to do. I turned on the TV set and pretended to watch baseball. And gazed at the indeterminate space between me and the set. I divided that space into two, and again into two. I did this over and over, until I’d made a space so small it could fit in the palm of my hand. At ten I turned off the TV, went back to my room, and went to sleep.
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Anyway, when he looked at his watch again it was ten o’clock. At ten o’clock she was lying on the divan with her boobies in her hands. That’s the way he gives it to me—in driblets.
Title: Tropic of Cancer
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: And now sometimes, in the very midst of things, sometimes when I feel that I am absolutely free of it all, suddenly, in rounding a corner perhaps, there will bob up a little square, a few trees and a bench, a deserted spot where we stood and had it out, where we drove each other crazy with bitter, jealous scenes. Always some deserted spot, like the Place de l’Estrapade, for example, or those dingy, mournful streets off the Mosque or along that open tomb of an Avenue de Breteuil which at ten o’clock in the evening is so silent, so dead, that it makes one think of murder or suicide, anything that might create a vestige of human drama.
Title: Tropic of Cancer
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: It was ten at night and everyone had gone home. I trudged up the dark stairway to clean out my desk. There was no sadness or nostalgia, only disgust that I’d wasted so much time on unnecessary labor when I could have been sleeping and feeling nothing. I’d been stupid to believe that employment would add value to my life.
Title: My Year of Rest and Relaxation
Author: Ottessa Moshfegh

Quote: D-Day. I reported to Ernie’s room thirty minutes after the Undead were put to bed at ten o’clock. “Last chance to back out if you don’t think you can hack it,” the artful Scot told me. “I’ve never backed out of anything in my life,” I replied, lying through my decaying teeth.
Title: Cloud Atlas
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: “A considerable crime is in contemplation. I have every reason to believe that we shall be in time to stop it. But to-day being Saturday rather complicates matters. I shall want your help to-night.” “At what time?” “Ten will be early enough.” “I shall be at Baker Street at ten.”
Title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: “A considerable crime is in contemplation. I have every reason to believe that we shall be in time to stop it. But to-day being Saturday rather complicates matters. I shall want your help to-night.” “At what time?” “Ten will be early enough.” “I shall be at Baker Street at ten.”
Title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: Her body asserted itself with a restless movement of her knee, and she stood up. “Ten o’clock,” she remarked, apparently finding the time on the ceiling. “Time for this good girl to go to bed.”
Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: While everyone ate, and I nibbled, Danièle said, “So this is the plan, Will. We will arrive at the entrance to the catacombs around ten o’clock. We will continue for four hours, then rest for one. Then it is another two hours or so to the spot where the camera was found.”
Title: The Catacombs
Author: Jeremy Bates

Quote: At ten o’clock she went into her double cell, where the woman she shared with was already asleep, and there was the reassuring clang of the door and click of the lock. It felt safe to be caged in, now that she knew she had this other person inside her who was capable of escapades and contortions she’d never known about before.
Title: The Heart Goes Last
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: Alone at the too-small child’s desk in her room, Eva finished the last line of the most pointless assignment ever, and though she wanted to start on the evening’s true mission immediately, she kept the box of churro bites closed under her bed. Her parents went to sleep at ten o’clock on weeknights. Only three and a half more hours to wait out.
Title: Kitchens of the Great Midwest
Author: J. Ryan Stradal

Quote: “Ten o’clock found them penniless. They had suppered greatly on their last eleven cents and, singing, strolled up through the casinos and lighted arches on the boardwalk, stopping to listen approvingly to all band concerts.”
Title: This Side of Paradise
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Meanwhile, the blood of the city’s saints had taken on a whole range of properties hitherto unknown to science. One lady’s was liquefying at precisely ten o’clock every Tuesday, while San Giovanni’s bubbled away obligingly whenever it heard Holy Scripture.
Title: The Wedding Officer
Author: by Anthony Capella

Quote: He glanced at the clock. 2200 hours. Getting on toward midnight. He hurried to dress.
Title: The Andromeda Strain
Author: Michael Crichton

Quote: By ten, Quoyle was drunk. The crowd was enormous, crushed together so densely that Nutbeem could not force his way down the hall or to the door and urinated on the remaining potato chips in the blue barrel, setting a popular example.
Title: The Shipping News
Author: E. Annie Proulx

Quote: Her body asserted itself with a restless movement of the knee, and she stood up. 'Ten o'clock,' she remarked, apparently finding the time on the ceiling. 'Time for this good girl to go to bed.'
Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: "I could not doubt that this was the BLACK SPOT; and taking it up, I found written on the other side, in a very good, clear hand, this short message: "You have till ten tonight."
Title: Treasure Island
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quote: I went back into the library, limp and exhausted. In a few minutes the telephone began ringing again. I did not do anything. I let it ring. I went and sat down at Maxim's feet. It went on ringing. I did not move. Presently it stopped, as though cut suddenly in exasperation. The clock on the mantelpiece struck ten o'clock. Maxim put his arms round me and lifted me against him. We began to kiss one another, feverishly, desperately, like guilty lovers who have not kissed before.
Title: Rebecca
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Quote: "No one wanted to go to bed when at ten o'clock Mrs. March put by the last finished job, and said, "Come girls." Beth went to the piano and played the father's favorite hymn."
Title: Little Women
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quote: The grandfather clock in the State Room strikes ten times.
Title: The Thousand Autumns of Jacob de Zoet
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: The light in Mr. Green's kitchen snapped off at nine-thirty, followed by the light in his bedroom at his usual ten o'clock. His house was the first on the street to go dark.
Title: A crime in the neighborhood
Author: Suzanne Berne

Quote: They were alone then, and theoretically free to do whatever they wanted, but they went on eating the dinner they had no appetite for. Florence set down her knife and reached for Edward's hand and squeezed. From downstairs they heard the wireless, the chimes of Big Ben at the start of the ten o'clock news.
Title: On Chesil Beach
Author: Ian McEwan

Quote: We let our upstairs room to a certain Mr. Goudsmit, a divorced man in his thirties, who appeared to have nothing to do on this particular evening; we simply could not get rid of him without being rude; he hung about until ten o'clock.
Title: Anne Frank: The Diary of a Young Girl
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: 10:01PM: Esiri, I'm so sorry for not listening to you and putting a bigger target on your back. I only wanted to help you.
Title: Ese: The Misadventures of Moving Forward
Author: Emoefeoghene (Efe) Akpofure Imoyin-Omene

Quote: It was now 10.02pm. He has less than two hours.
Title: The Lost Symbol
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: At 10.03pm the ushers pull open the doors and I watch the now-familiar footage of the audience surging into the night, noticeably excited.
Title: The Dark Lake
Author: Sarah Bailey

Quote: She quickly glanced at the carriage clock resting on the centre of the mantelpiece — 10:04pm. She made her way to the front door. 'Who is it?' she called out from her side of the locked door. 'It's John Poole.' Sophie was glad the door was closed and that Poole couldn't see her look of astonishment.
Title: The Naturals: And Other Short Stories
Author: GMSEED

Quote: The A-B elevator was our elevator, the elevator on which the paramedics came up at 9:20 p.m., the elevator on which they took John (and me) downstairs to the ambulance at 10:05 p.m.
Title: The Year of Magical Thinking
Author: Joan Didion

Quote: Of course, they had good reason to be fussy on such a night. And then it was long after ten o'clock and yet there was no sign of Gabriel and his wife. Besides they were dreadfully afraid that Freddy Malins might turn up screwed.
Title: The Dead
Author: James Joyce

Quote: When the phone rang at seven minutes after ten, she was tempted not to answer it, but decided to hear him out. “I thought you'd decided not to answer,” he said after a greeting that she was certain would have been more affable if she'd picked up on the first two or three rings.
Title: Yes, I Do
Author: Gwynne Forster

Quote: "My watch is always a little fast," I said. "What time do you make it now?" "Ten eight." "Ten eighteen by mine. You see."
Title: The Quiet American
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: Marie said he left her apartment around ten, and Mrs. Peabody had seen him reach home at nine minutes after ten —just about time to have walked the distance from the Las Felice, but not enough to conclude that his blackmail scheme had fallen through.
Title: Framed in Blood
Author: Brett Halliday

Quote: That was the past, and now I had just died on the narrow couch of a Paris lodging house, and my wife was crouching on the floor, crying bitterly. The white light before my left eye was growing dim, but I remembered the room perfectly. On the left there was a chest of drawers, on the right a mantelpiece surmounted by a damaged clock without a pendulum, the hands of which marked ten minutes past ten. The window overlooked the Rue Dauphine, a long, dark street. All Paris seemed to pass below, and the noise was so great that the window shook.
Title: The Death of Olivier Becaille
Author: Emile Zola

Quote: 10.10pm. When you turn your recorder on you must adjust clock and the calendar.......Press red and nothing happens. Press numbers and nothing happens. Wish stupid video had never been invented.
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: Therefore a sergeant called Trifonov had been on post all day or all week and then he had left at eleven minutes past ten in the evening.
Title: The Enemy
Author: Lee Child

Quote: The Chinese women scuttled at an amazing rate, given their size and the bags' size. It was c. 2212:30-40h., smack in the middle of the former Interval of Issues Resolution.
Title: Infinite Jest
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: Julius looked at the luminous clock on the instrument panel, saw it was thirteen minutes after ten. He was leaving the enormous mass of lights that were Phoenix behind and moving towards the small cluster he knew was Apache Junction.
Title: Journey Towards Forever
Author: Robert D'Artagnan

Quote: The shopping bags looked heavy and impressive, their weight making the Chinese women lean in slightly towards each other. Call it 2214:10h.
Title: Infinite Jest
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: Domino two had me standing sentinel in Mr. Meek’s room watching through the crack in the door. Due to his advanced state of decay, our loyal boiler room mascot wasn’t in on the great escape, but his room was opposite mine, and he understood “Shush!” At a quarter past ten Ernie went to Reception to announce my death to Nurse Noakes.
Title: Cloud Atlas
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: 10:15 p.m. Aargh Newsnight on in 15 minutes
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: INT. 10:16PM YONGBYON, NORTH KOREA-FOURTH FLOOR OF THE SPACE CENTER A chemical filled satellite is launched from the fourth floor of the Space Center.
Title: Fahrenheit Classified: Holy War
Author: Tavares Rankins

Quote: It was already seventeen minutes past ten when Phil closed the door and turned out the light on the landing, but I knew I couldn’t leave straight away.
Title: I Never Gave My Consent
Author: Holly Archer

Quote: 10:17 p. m. Casette will not go in
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: "My watch is always a little fast," I said. "What time do you make it now?" "Ten eight." "Ten eighteen by mine. You see."
Title: The Quiet American
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: 10:18pm. Ah. Thelma and Louise is in there
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: At nineteen minutes after ten Ric the Vampire came down the sidewalk carrying a little white bag and took it into the meat plant. Danish, no doubt.
Title: Lullaby Town
Author: Robert Crais

Quote: When I closed my eyes, the scent of the wind wafted up toward me. A May wind, swelling up like a piece of fruit, with a rough outer skin, slimy flesh, dozens of seeds. The flesh split open in midair, spraying seeds like gentle buckshot into the bare skin of my arms, leaving behind a faint trace of pain. “What time is it?” my cousin asked me. About eight inches shorter than me, he had to look up when he talked. I glanced at my watch. “Ten twenty.”
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: "At 10:20 she returned with a shopping bag from the supermarket. In the bag were three scrub brushes, one box of paperclips and a well-chilled six-pack of canned beer. So I had another beer. "It was about sheep," I said. "Didn't I tell you?" she said."
Title: A Wild Sheep Chase
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: 10:21pm. Frenziedly press all buttons. Cassette comes out and goes back in again
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: 10:21pm. Thelma and Louise will not come out
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: On a Saturday c. 2221h., Lenz found a miniature bird that had fallen out of some nest and was sitting bald and pencil-necked on the lawn of Unit #3 flapping ineffectually, and went in with Green and ducked Green and went back outside to # 3's lawn and put the thing in a pocket and went in and put it down the garbage disposal in the kitchen sink of the kitchen, but still felt largely impotent and unresolved.
Title: Infinite Jest
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: On a Saturday c. 2221h., Lenz found a miniature bird that had fallen out of some nest and was sitting bald and pencil-necked on the lawn of Unit #3 flapping ineffectually...
Title: Infinite Jest
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: The black hands on its silver face pointed to twenty-two minutes after ten. The two hours that had passed since Sylvia had looked at the blood-red of her glass and shuddered were like two eternities.
Title: The Invisible Host
Author: Gwen Bristow, Bruce Manning

Quote: His screen read twenty-three minutes after ten pm when the skyline seemed to erupt with light sweeping out the night.
Title: Fallen Phoenix
Author: William Markwalder

Quote: Thanks to ten minutes or so of balmy weather, by 10:24 the Earth is covered in the great carboniferous forests whose residues give us all our coal, and the first winged insects are evident.
Title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
Author: Bill Bryson

Quote: “The last phone call came at ten twenty-five p.m. that night when I was listening to Erroll Garner’s Concert by the Sea and drinking Seagram’s VO. Handy, isn’t it, keeping a diary like this?”
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: "10:25pm. Got new cassette in now. Right. Turn to "Recording......... ......... Aargh Newsnight is starting"
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: As always, consciousness returned to me progressively from the edges of my field of vision. The first things to claim recognition were the bathroom door emerging from the far right and a lamp from the far left, from which my awareness gradually drifted inward like ice flowing together toward the middle of a lake. In the exact center of my visual field was the alarm clock, hands pointing to ten-twenty-six.
Title: Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: “Should you be having caffeine at”—Olive glanced at the clock—“ten twenty-seven p.m.?” Come to think of it, he shouldn’t be having caffeine at all, given his baseline shiny personality. And yet the two of them got coffee together every Wednesday. Olive was nothing but an enabler.
Title: The Love Hypothesis
Author: Ali Hazelwood

Quote: Mr Harcourt woke up with mysterious suddenness at twenty-seven minutes past 10, and, by a curious coincidence, it was at that very instant that the butler came in with two footmen laden with trays of whisky, brandy, syphons, glasses and biscuits.
Title: England, Their England
Author: AG Macdonell

Quote_Time: twenty eight minutes past ten pm
Quote: If either of them had checked a watch at that time, it would have read twenty eight minutes past ten pm. They ran. It had started to rain. They ran to the farm, arriving out of breath and scared witless.
Title: Becoming Amos
Author: Amos Godwin

Quote: Even when I had to say something, the right words just wouldn’t come out. And every time I hesitated, every time I swallowed back something I was about to say, my cousin looked at me with a slightly confused look on his face. His left ear tilted ever so slightly toward me.  “What time is it now?” he asked me. “Ten twenty nine,” I replied.
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: “It was ten-thirty. And summer. And then it was a little later. Night had come at last, completely. There was no room that night, in that town, for love. ”
Title: Ten
Author: thirty on a summer night

Quote: Still, despite her endless consternation, for the third night in a row she slipped out at half past ten and made her way to the edge of the estate, where Aleandro would wait for her near an abandoned wine cellar, which had become their meeting place.
Title: When the Summer Was Ours
Author: Roxanne Veletzos

Quote: They have their first fight at ten-thirty that night. It’s over who’s going to sleep in the bed and who’s going to sleep on the couch. Billy insists that she take the bed, says he’ll be fine on the couch. “That’s sexist.” “Sleeping on the couch is sexist? Are you kidding me?” “Being a manly man is sexist. You’re too long for it. Your feet will hang out on the floor.”
Title: Billy Summers
Author: Stephen King

Quote: “What are you getting?” He addressed this to the air in front of him, without turning toward her. “I’m sorry?” “I’ve been sent for ice,” he said. “What do you need?” “Oh, nothing. I’m off home.” “At ten thirty on New Year’s Eve? That is either the saddest or the wisest thing I’ve ever heard.”
Title: Cleopatra and Frankenstein
Author: by Coco Mellors

Quote: At ten thirty, Kendra found herself on the couch again, this time with Christy. She felt uncomfortable sitting next to her, especially after the barrage of hate her coworkers had thrown at the blonde, but Christy seemed unusually approachable right then, all smiles and laughs and easy-flowing gestures.
Title: Reprieve
Author: James Han Mattson

Quote: She looked at the clock; it was ten thirty. If she could get there quickly on the subway, then she could be at his house in less than an hour, maybe a bit longer if the late trains did not come so often.
Title: Brooklyn
Author: Colm Toibin

Quote: The time was ten-thirty but it could have been three in the morning, because along its borders, West Berlin goes to bed with the dark
Title: Smiley's People
Author: John Le Carre

Quote: 10.31pm. Ok OK. Calm. Penny Husbands-Bosworth, so asbestos leukaemia item is not on yet.
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: And, later on, at 10.31 pm, I went out onto the balcony to find out whether I could see any stars, but there weren't any because of all the clouds and what is called Light Pollution which is light from streetlights and car headlights and floodlights and lights in buildings reflecting off tiny particles in the atmosphere and getting in the way of light from the stars. So I went back inside.
Title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time
Author: Mark Haddon

Quote: It was ten thirty-two when the bus finally rolled into view. The bus that came was a new type, not like the one I used to take to high school.
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: 10:33 p.m. Yessss, yessss. RECORDING CURRENT PROGRAMME. Have done it. Aargh. All going mad. Cassette has started rewinding and now stopped and ejected. Why? Shit. Shit. Realize in excitement have sat on remote control.
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: 10:33pm. Yessss, yessss. RECORDING CURRENT PROGRAMME. Have done it. Aargh. All going mad. Cassette has started rewinding and now stopped and ejected. Why? Shit. Shit. Realize in excitement have sat on remote control.
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: —things do not feel right to me. 10:28pm  —me too. my hubby is making fun of me, but I can't help it. I am scared. 10:31pm  —put on your tinfoil hat, sister. 10:34pm
Title: Cutting Teeth
Author: Julia Fierro

Quote: If he did not return in fourteen minutes he would have lingered. She looked at the clock. It was twenty-five minutes to eleven. He might enter the inn with Arabella, as they would reach it before closing time; she might get him to drink with her; and Heaven only knew what disasters would befall him then.
Title: Jude the Obscure
Author: Thomas Hardy

Quote: 10:35 p.m. Frantic now. Have rung Sahzzer, Rebecca, Simon, Magda. Nobody knows how to programme their videos. Only person I know who knows how to do it is Daniel.
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: It was twenty four minutes to eleven when Tris began the review of the second loan file.
Title: The Mending
Author: R. R. Emmett

Quote: At twenty-four minutes to eleven her heart had stopped pumping the blood around her body. One single muscle in a single person's body. A speck of dust in time. And the world was dead.
Title: Handling the Undead
Author: John Ajvide Lindqvist

Quote: “What are you doing, Turpini? It is thirty-seven minutes past ten of the clock and you are not at all foofed in the panoply of your state. Hurry! Hurry!”
Title: Small Persons with Wings
Author: Ellen Booraem

Quote: After a pause, he pulled a heavy gold watch from his pocket. He flicked it open and contemplated its face. “Well, Mrs. Barnard. Do your worst. It's thirty-eight minutes after ten.”
Title: Proof By Seduction
Author: Courtney Milan

Quote: New text from Kat: 10:39pm No. 'Wht do u mean no?' New text from Kat: 10:41pm::knife emoji:: I can only be friends on this matter to one at a time. Andy has made a claim. Find your own friend.
Title: Daybreak in Sandbridge
Author: Elizabeth L. Brooks

Quote: “My friend,” she said with a pleased tone to her voice that she knew he could not mistake. She didn’t care, she was pleased to hear from him, even if it was ten-forty at night. “Where are you calling from?” she asked, expecting him to say Glasgow or Berlin.
Title: It All Began in Monte Carlo
Author: Elizabeth Adler

Quote: When fifteen minutes have passed and the bogus DPW truck hasn’t returned, Billy decides they have either moved on to another part of the city, maybe to check out the house on Evergreen Street, or have gone back to the McMansion to await further orders from Nick. He closes the curtain, shutting out the view, and looks at his watch. It’s twenty to eleven. How time flies when you’re having fun, he thinks.
Title: Billy Summers
Author: Stephen King

Quote: The station clock told him the time: twenty to eleven. He went to the booking office and asked the clerk in a polite tone when was the next train to Paris. 'In twelve minutes.'
Title: The Man Who Watched the Trains Go By
Author: Georges Simenon

Quote: "He climbed into the front seat and started the car. It started with a merry powerful hum, ready to go. "There, the bastards", said Julian, and smashed the clock with the bottom of the bottle, to give them an approximate time. It was 10:41"
Title: Appointment in Samarra
Author: John O'Hara

Quote: “Forty-two minutes past ten!” said Nicholl. “Only five minutes more!” answered Barbicane. “Yes, five little minutes!” replied Michel Ardan; “and we are enclosed in a projectile, at the bottom of a gun 900 feet long!
Title: Round the Moon
Author: Jules Verne

Quote: 10:40 to 10:43 P.M. —approximate—Motorist Ellen Taaffe traveling east on Sherman Way, windows down, hears popping sound as she passes the Sherman Market.
Title: Blood Work
Author: Michael Connelly

Quote: "Alec pricked up his ears. "When was that?" "Oh, yesterday evening." "What time?" "About a quarter to eleven. I was playing bridge."
Title: Dead in the Water
Author: Carola Dunn

Quote: 10.45pm. Oh God Daniel fell about laughing when I said I could not programme video. Said he would do it for me. Still at least I have done best for Mum. It is exciting and historic when one's friends are on TV.
Title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Author: Helen Fielding

Quote: So the Lackadaisical Broadcasting Co. bids you farewell with the message that if you aren't grateful to be living in a world where so many things to be grateful for are yours as a matter of course. Why it is now five seconds until fifteen minutes before eleven o'clock and you are just an old Trojan Horse.
Title: Good Intentions
Author: Ogden Nash

Quote: The 'night train' tallied to perfection, for high tide in the creek would be, as Davies estimated, between 10.30 and 11.00 p.m.on the night of the 25th; and the time-table showed that the only night train arriving at Norden was one from the south at 10.46 p.m.
Title: The Riddle of the Sands
Author: Erskine Childers

Quote: On my screen the remaining theatregoers slowly drift away and when the timestamp clicks over to 10.47pm there is no one left.
Title: The Dark Lake
Author: Sarah Bailey

Quote: "Oh! I don't know about that," said Mr. Satterthwaite, warming to his subject. "I was down there for a bit last summer. I found it quite convenient for town. Of course the trains only go every hour. 48 minutes past the hour from Waterloo-up to 10.48."
Title: The Sign in the Sky
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: It's well after 2245h. The dog's leash slides hissing to the end of the Day-Glo line and stops the dog a couple of paces from the inside of the gate, where Lenz is standing, inclined in the slight forward way of somebody who's talking baby-talk to a dog.
Title: Infinite Jest
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: 10.50 P. M. This diary-keeping of mine is, I fancy, the outcome of that scientific habit of mind about which I wrote this morning. I like to register impressions while they are fresh.
Title: The Parasite
Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: "Saturday night. And I said, 'It's a hundred this year, ain't anybody noticed?'"Jack said, 'What's a hundred?' I said, 'Pub is. Coach is. Look at the clock.' Jack said, ‘It's ten to eleven’."
Title: Last Orders
Author: Graham Swift

Quote: So think yourself lucky while you're awake and remember a happy crew. Think of Hamburg on the Magic Night. 22.50 and they went out neatly, just as they should - you couldn't fault Parks, he was always on his route.
Title: Day
Author: A. L. Kennedy

Quote: How did they get out there back of Vawter's—Peacock and X? They arranged to meet there. In advance? No. After Peacock arrived, at nine minutes to eleven. They spoke, there on the dance floor, and arranged to meet outside.
Title: Death of a Dude
Author: Rex Stout

Quote: All at once, at eight minutes to eleven, the luck turned in his favour, and his pile mounted again. Time after time he dropped doublesixes. It was almost uncanny. He seemed to see the dice in the box, and his hand threw them out with the precision of a machine.
Title: Northern Lights
Author: Gilbert Parker

Quote: I set the cup down and retrieved a small notebook from my breast pocket. After thumbing a few pages I found the entry I wanted. “He radioed dispatch at fifty-three minutes after ten from your dealership.”
Title: Before She Dies
Author: Steven F. Havill

Quote: “Kiera. Don't say anything about needing fresh air. You know of the threat. What if you get kidnapped while in your sleep?” she debunked my last piece of excuse. It was six minutes to eleven now.
Title: Searching for Love, Found Wealth
Author: Princess Treasure Chuks

Quote_Time: Eleven o'clock, all but five minutes!
Quote: "It is eleven o'clock! Eleven o'clock, all but five minutes!" "But which eleven o'clock?" "The eleven o'clock that is to decide life or death!...He told me so just before he went....He is terrible....He is quite mad: he tore off his mask and his yellow eyes shot flames!..."
Title: The Phantom of the Opera
Author: Gaston Leroux

Quote: It was four minutes to eleven, and I was arriving at the very last moment. I had left home in plenty of time, but the city was still marked by the riots, and it turned out that the streetcars on Line 4 were not running between Avenue Deuxième and Réunion Square.
Title: A Lady in Shadows
Author: Lene Kaaberbøl

Quote: Wait till, say, three minutes to eleven, then find him all set up. To arrest him, he must have set up his rifle for a court to convict him, and he can't shoot from the car.
Title: Pandemic
Author: Dieter Gartelmann

Quote: She waits, but nobody comes. Not even a layabout, as Madame Habib would say. It is twenty to eleven, twelve minutes to eleven, three minutes to eleven, and she has never felt so alone.
Title: Clara Reads Proust
Author: Stephane Carlier

Quote: Then it grew dark; she would have had them to bed, but they begged sadly to be allowed to stay up; and, just about eleven o’clock, the door-latch was raised quietly, and in stepped the master.
Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Brontë

Quote: They parked the car outside Lowther's at precisely one minute to eleven. People were leaving, not all of them happy at having their evening curtailed. But the grumbling was muted, and even then it only started once they were safely on the street.
Title: The Complaints
Author: Ian Rankin
